column8: Ridin' with Biden in Ave Maria and Immokalee
column9:
This event is a statewide car caravan throughout Florida to support Joe Biden and all our local candidates. We are looking for participants and lead drivers. Cars can be decorated with American flags, Biden and local candidate signs, flags, bumper stickers, etc. – please no balloons. Routes are being drafted and will be distributed before the event.

When: Sun. Aug 16, 2020
Time: 2 pm
Where: several caravand around Collier County (primarily in the Naples, Marco, Ave Maria and Immokalee areas). Routes are being drafted.
Need: Participants and lead car drivers

column8: Digital Day of Action for Tim Ryan
column9: Join us for our first day of action! We'll be doing it 100% digital. This day will be a text bank and phone bank. We'll kick off at 11AM with some words from the Congressman, and then we'll dive right into a quick training and start reaching out to voters! Join us as we make every single one of these last 100 days count!

column8: Chat with NCSD Candidate Harper Peterson from  New Hanover County & phonebank with C2C!
column9:
Join our “Conversation with the Candidate” zoom and then make some calls and help elect democratic candidates to the North Carolina General Assembly

Check out Harper Peterson HERE:  https://countytocountync.org/harper-peterson

We'd love to have you join our team, so please sign up for a phone bank.  We will provide online training and text and phone support so that you will feel confident joining the phone banks from your home.

The County to County Campaign is focused on turning the NC General Assembly BLUE! If we can do this, we will advance policies that benefit all North Carolinians and stop extreme partisan gerrymandering.

Join us in our work with partner counties across the state.

column8: Denver National Weekend of Action Virtual Phone Bank
column9:
Colorado needs your help! Making phone calls is an amazing way to help elect Democrats up and down the ballot while staying socially distant.

We especially welcome first-time volunteers, who would like to join a historic grassroots movement across our country. All you need is internet access and a laptop (or tablet, if you have one).

Before your shift starts, your local organizer will reach out to give you all the training you need to start phone banking. We will get you set up, walk through how our phone banks work, give you a script to help guide your conversations, and answer any questions you might have.

RSVP now, and invite a friend to join you!

column8: Denver Call Crew Training
column9:
Join us for a ThruTalk training! ThruTalk is our phone-banking dialer system that we'll use to help maximize volunteers' efficiency this summer.

We will introduce you to the campaign, talk about our grassroots organizing strategy, and invite you to join our people-powered movement.

We especially welcome those who have never been part of a campaign before. All you have to do is show up! We need all the help we can get to elect Colorado Democrats up and down the ballot in November.

Sign up and we’ll invite you to the training via Zoom. You’ll get to meet others who are passionate about making a difference in this election, and strategize how to support the issues we all care about.

RSVP now, and invite a friend to join you!

column8: Centre County Day of Action: Our Planet, Our Future
column9:
The Centre County Dems invite you to a socially distanced Day of Action on Sunday, August 16th from 1-4 PM!

We'll start with an optional Zoom call from 1-1:30 PM. Join us at:
https://us02web.zoom.us/j/86209368185

Then, from 1:30-4 PM, stop by our pick-up stations for our various activities in the atrium of 315 S. Allen St., where our offices our located, or get started from home. You can also have materials delivered if you are immunocompromised or are within an at-risk group.

*Masks are required at the CCDC event*

Please fill out the form below so that we can provide you with the materials and instructions necessary to complete your projects.

ACTIVITY DESCRIPTIONS

All activities are contactless.

Texting for Joe Biden:
Send text messages through an application from your computer. After signing up for this option, Eric (esd1974@gmail.com), our Centre County texting coordinator, will contact you to help get you set up and to set goals for the team. It's easy (once you get set up)!

Postcards for Peter Buck:
Your postcard packet comes with 30 postcards with a list of names and addresses of Centre County voters.There is space for handwritten messages about why you're supporting Peter Buck for the 171st House race this November.

Postcards Promoting Mail-in Voting and Voting Democratic:
Your environmentally themed packet of 30 postcards will encourage mail-in voting to Centre County voters. You'll have space on the back for a handwritten message about why you are supporting all Democratic candidates this November.

Literature Drop-Joe Waltz:
Go door to door to hang literature for Joe Waltz on the doorknobs of targeted Centre County Democratic-leaning voters in Benner Township. No knocking or contact with residents is required.

Literature Drops--Peter Buck:
Go door to door to hang literature for Peter Buck on the doorknobs of targeted Centre County Democratic-leaning voters in College, Harris, and Ferguson Townships. No knocking or contact with residents is required.

Virtual Phone Bank:
Call voters with the PA Democrats. After signing up, you will be contacted by Back to Blue organizers to get you set up.

Community Service:
Bring items to the atrium on Sunday for the Penns Valley Family Service Center
PRIORITY: Non Food Items
Cleaning supplies
Laundry Detergent
Soap
Toiletries: deodorant, shampoo and conditioner
Toothpaste
Paper Towels
Toilet Paper
Feminine products
Diapers
OTHER REQUESTS: Food & Drink
Juice
Non perishable food items
Canned goods
Dry goods
Non food items

column8: Jacksonville, FL - Register Democrats to save the world in 2020!
column9:
Want to fight Trump and the GOP circus of horrors, and make a real difference? Come register Democrats with us!

Empowering new Democrats is the #1 most direct, effective way to fight the Trump regime and save our country in 2020.

No experience necessary. We'll start with a 15-minute training and deploy to some local hot spots. We'll have everything you need - clipboards, forms, and pens. Just bring a little water, sunscreen, some comfortable shoes, and maybe a hat.

NOTE: Wear a liberal-looking t-shirt if you have one. It can really help. (And if you don't have one, no worries! We may have extras.)

COMPLETELY OPTIONAL: If you'd like to be extra prepared, you can...

1) check out this voter registration training video we made with Swing Left: https://vimeo.com/235034277 (It's for CA, but the general principles apply in every state.)

2) Read the Field Team 6 guide "How to Register Democrats" here: https://bit.ly/2ISLnfx

3) Sign up for a voter registration training video call here: https://www.mobilize.us/ft6/?is_virtual=true

If you can, bring a friend - can't wait to see you there!

column8: Flip PA with your phone (PA Team)
column9:
The Swing Left Greater Boston PA phonebanking team is finally calling into PA ! After a successful PA Primary, we are now calling on behalf of amazing candidates in PA. Please join our team of phonebankers as we lend our momentum to build support for Democrats in PA. This effort is crucial to building a Blue Wave in November!

Making calls is the most effective way for us to reach voters right now. It’s very simple – if you’ve never phoned with us before, we’ll walk you through it step by step. We need YOU to help us get the word out to make sure Democrats can have their voices heard.

Before you join our virtual get-together in Zoom, please have your laptop, battery/charger, phone, headphones and paper and pen handy. We kick off with a few notes for experienced phone bankers and then quickly get instructions to our new callers to get them up to speed. For new volunteers, we’ll review the script and learn how to use Open VPB.

Bring your family and friends! This is a fun and welcoming phone banking community, and we always love having new folks join!

Looking forward to seeing you!

Nick and Jake

column8: Help Reach Latino Voters in Florida (Postcards)
column9:
A Florida vote by mail postcard to-go event is a safe and effective way for you to help flip Florida - our country's largest swing state. You'll personalize and address postcards to likely Democrats, telling them how to request a Vote By Mail ballot. Our postcards increase their probability of applying to vote by mail. And when they apply to vote by mail, it makes it significantly more likely they will cast a ballot.

You can write the postcards from your own home! Just pick up your packet of 30 postcards and addresses, customize the postcards at home, and return the postcards by the deadline date.

The cost of each packet is $25. Using check or PayPal expedites your pick up.

## Additional Precautions
Please protect your health and the health of the community.

If you have underlying health conditions or other risk factors, please ask a friend to pick up your packets for you. We may be able to drop them off at your home; ask if you need that.

Thank you for helping us turn out Florida's Blue voters. We'll both take back the White House and blunt Republican gerrymandering!

HOST: Laurie Covens - lauriecovens2011@gmail.com

A final note: If you don't receive an email confirming your RSVP, you can still find the information you need by checking "My Volunteer Schedule."  (Instructions [here](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1kCVbAJ8BSO5InlZcz-CDCbs5gblUp8KTs3ATC457_W4/edit?usp=sharing)).

column8: Order of the Phoenix Phonebank for Michele Knoll & Joe Biden
column9:
Hello, Phoenixers!

The OoP is excited to phone bank for Michele Knoll and Joe Biden on Sunday, August 16th! This event represents a fantastic opportunity to connect with swing voters to help Michele flip HD44 while also getting out the vote for Joe Biden.

Here’s how it will work:

3:00 Meet briefly in Zoom to check in with your friends, hear from the candidate, and go over campaign talking points. We will make sure you have all of the information you need to call with confidence.

3:15 Start phonebanking! You can either mute yourself in Zoom or leave Zoom and rejoin when you’re done. Training and practice will be provided for anyone new to phone banking. We will be on hand to support you while you dial and answer any questions that come up.

4:45 Return to Zoom to share stories, hang out, and maybe have a celebratory drink.

5:00 You’re finished, having done your part to ensure victory in November! How awesome are you?!?

Here’s what you’ll need to do in advance: Make sure you have an Action ID account. You’ll need this to log in to the virtual phone bank. If you have canvassed using the MiniVAN app or phone banked before, you probably already have one. If not, here are the instructions. https://drive.google.com/file/d/1eHyDbbhUH93oEnplFbNHZbhO1noROsE_/view

Need help? Contact Jen Sybrandt at jsybrandt@back2blue2020.com.

When you sign up, you will receive an email with more information!

We will send you the link for the Phone Bank the night before to make sure that it is the most up to date list of voters.

Thank you, as always, for your commitment to democracy.

Order of the Phoenix

column8: Kagan For Florida: August Text-Banking
column9:
Thank you for your interest in textbanking on behalf of Tracey Kagan and her campaign for Florida House District 29!

We will be hosting a 30 minute instructional session on SATURDAY, AUGUST 15th at 3:00PM via ZOOM, with the link to be sent out after signing up. This session will be mandatory for everyone who wants to textbank, even if you have textbanked before with us.

The August campaign will be reaching out to Democrats and NPAs in highly-targeted areas to ensure name ID of Tracey, as well as following up on previous conversations. Once you get started on August 15th with our session, the expectation is to be continually textbanking consistently and frequently until the campaign is over by end of August.

You will need a: - Phone/computer.

Mahdi Kassam will be in touch with you via email once signing up, and will follow up via phonecall as well. Please reach out for anything.

Mahdi Kassam (407) 415-8996

column8: Weekend of Action Phone Bank in Greater Cincinnati
column9:
Join us making calls for our weekend of action, here in the greater Cincinnati area! We'll be asking voters in Southwest Ohio about support for Biden and Democrats across the ticket this year.

Every shift will start with a brief training/tech troubleshooting over Zoom. Once everyone is set up we'll be making calls for about 2 hours, during which I would highly recommend everyone stay on our Zoom call and simply mute so as to not disturb the rest of the group as we're making calls, while preserving our ability to ask questions, get help on the fly, and simulate that sense of comradery we are so desperate for as we can't work together in the same room.

column8: Women's Empower Hour Southeast Wayne County
column9:
Join the Michigan Democrats in Downriver for a discussion on empowerment in politics for women, trans, and nonbinary people following the Women's Caucus from 4-6PM during the Democratic National Convention. To join the Women's Caucus, register here: https://www.demconvention.com/event/womens-caucus-meeting-wednesday-august-19/

Let's share stories and chat about our experiences in the workforce and our path towards gender equality. **Joe Biden acknowledges that women - particularly women of color - have never had a fair shot to get ahead in this country.** He believes every issue is a women’s issue - health care, the economy, education, national security- but women are also uniquely and disproportionately impacted by many policies.

**People of all genders are welcome to join us in discussing how we can create a more inclusive world.** We hope to see you there - bring your friends and family!

Once you sign-up, you’ll receive an email with a Zoom link to access the event. If you have any questions, please don’t hesitate to reach out to the event organizer by emailing Tatjana at tkunz@1campaignmi.com.

column8: Take Back Florida from Your Own Living Room
column9:
A Florida vote by mail postcard to-go event is a safe and effective way for you to help flip Florida - our country's largest swing state. You'll personalize and address postcards to likely Democrats, telling them how to request a Vote By Mail ballot. Our postcards increase their probability of applying to vote by mail. And when they apply to vote by mail, it makes it significantly more likely they will cast a ballot.

You can write the postcards from your own home! Just pick up your packet of 20 postcards and addresses, customize the postcards at home, and return the postcards between Aug 15-22.

The cost of each packet of 20 postcards and all the supplies you need is $17. Using paypal or venmo make things easy.

## Additional Precautions
Please protect your health and the health of the community.

If you have underlying health conditions or other risk factors, please ask a friend to pick up your packets for you. We may be able to drop them off at your home; ask if you need that.

Thank you for helping us turn out Florida's Blue voters. We'll both take back the White House and blunt Republican gerrymandering!

Kimberly Hirsh
kimber02129@gmail.com

A final note: If you don't receive an email confirming your RSVP, you can still find the information you need by checking "My Volunteer Schedule."  (Instructions [here](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1kCVbAJ8BSO5InlZcz-CDCbs5gblUp8KTs3ATC457_W4/edit?usp=sharing)).

column8: Weekend of Action in Phoenix!
column9:
We need your help during our first Statewide Virtual Weekend of Action talking to voters about Democrats up and down the ticket. A phone bank is a great way to reach voters and talk about issues we all care about.

With the importance placed on Arizona this November, we need to reach out and talk to voters about Joe Biden, Mark Kelly and AZ Dems now, even as we practice social distancing. Virtual phone banks have become an essential part of turning Arizona blue, and every phonbanker plays a pivotal role.  This will be our biggest weekend yet as a campaign, and we need your help.

Whether you’re new to campaigns or an expert, you have a place with our people-powered campaign. The good news is, phone banking is easy to learn and can be done from the comfort of your own home!

You will need a phone (and a laptop or tablet, if you have one). Prior to your phonebanking shift, your local organizer will reach out for a comprehensive training, where we’ll get you set up, walk you through our phonebanking process and script, and answer any questions you might have.

Volunteers will help Mission for Arizona unite Democrats across Arizona and build upon our historic success in 2018 to elect Mark Kelly and Democrats up and down the ticket.

RSVP today and invite a friend to join us!

column8: Bensalem Convention Watch Party - Joe Biden Accepts the DNC Nomination
column9: Join us on the last night of the Democratic Convention as we watch Vice President Joe Biden accept our party's nomination for President of the United States. column8: West Oakland County English As a Second Language Phonebank
column9:
Join Michigan Democrats who speak English as a second language in Oakland County for a virtual phone bank! This is a huge year for Michigan, and we need all hands on deck to send Joe Biden to the White House, re-elect Senator Gary Peters and elect Democrats up and down the ballot. You can help take part in this crucial effort by making calls from home!

Each event will kick off with a quick training to make sure you have all the information you need to have a fun and successful shift. We’ll provide you with a virtual list of phone numbers to call and a script to help guide your conversation. All you need to make calls is a phone, computer or tablet, and access to the internet. Once you sign-up, you’ll receive an email with a link to access the training.

Have questions about registering to make calls, logging-in, the script, or anything else? Shoot the event organizer an email at mmorales@1campaignmi.com

Thanks for joining - please invite a friend or two to join you!

column9:
Join us for a virtual phone bank to talk with voters in Philadelphia about electing Pennsylvania Democrats up and down the ballot!

The most effective way for us to reach voters right now is through phone calls, and we need you to help us get the word out to make sure Democrats can have their voices heard.

WHAT YOU'LL NEED
— A computer with reliable internet service
— A mobile or landline phone
— A comfy, quiet place in your home

To get started, we recommend opening the phone bank and getting set up a few minutes before your scheduled start time so you can focus on having good conversations for your full shift. We recommend using a recent version of Chrome or Firefox as your internet browser to access the link.

column8: Take Back Florida from Your Own Living Room
column9:
A Florida vote by mail postcard to-go event is a safe and effective way for you to help flip Florida - our country's largest swing state. You'll personalize and address postcards to likely Democrats, telling them how to request a Vote By Mail ballot. Our postcards increase their probability of applying to vote by mail. And when they apply to vote by mail, it makes it significantly more likely they will cast a ballot.

You can write the postcards from your own home! Just pick up your packet of 30 postcards and addresses, customize the postcards at home, and return the postcards by the deadline date.

Your packet includes 30 postcards, 60 postcard stamps, a mailing list and instructions.  A Florida Democrats finance form is also provided and can be filled in a pick up or returned via email photo.  The cost of each packet is $25. Using check or exact change expedites your pick up.

The Boston Back Bay pick-up location will be emailed to you after sign-up.

## Additional Precautions
Please protect your health and the health of the community.

If you have underlying health conditions or other risk factors, please ask a friend to pick up your packets for you. We may be able to drop them off at your home; ask if you need that.

Thank you for helping us turn out Florida's Blue voters. We'll both take back the White House and blunt Republican gerrymandering!

**HOST: Suzanne Oakley  oakley_s@yahoo.com

A final note: If you don't receive an email confirming your RSVP, you can still find the information you need by checking "My Volunteer Schedule."  (Instructions [here](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1kCVbAJ8BSO5InlZcz-CDCbs5gblUp8KTs3ATC457_W4/edit?usp=sharing)).

column8: Gun Violence Prevention Crash Course
column9:
Join Mission for AZ Summer Leaders for an informative crash course on the gun violence in the United States. Learn about the extent to which this problem plagues our country and hear the stories of people whose lives have been affected by gun violence.

Speakers:
Gerry Hills - Gerry became a strong advocate for gun violence prevention after her brother was killed by man with an assault rifle. She founded Arizonans for Gun Safety in 1995 and is currently serving as the organization’s President and primary lobbyist. She is a nationally recognized organizer, speaker, and gun violence prevention
advocate. She has a degree in Management and Master’s in Nonprofit Studies from ASU, with a certification in Public Management.

Melinda Martinez - Melinda is an 18 year old LatinX activist and a gun violence survivor. Her experiences with gun violence have given her an entirely new outlook on the issue, and she works with multiple organizations and brands to bring awareness to the cause.

Kara Waite - Kara is the state chapter lead for the Arizona Chapter of Moms Demand Action for Gun Sense in America. She is a “policy wonk” who is deeply committed to gun violence prevention and anti-racism work.

Please contact Carly Berke or Michaela Davenport with any questions or concerns surrounding this event:
cberke@missionforarizona.com
mdavenport@missionforarizona.com

Before your shift starts, your local organizer will reach out to give you all the training you need to start phone banking. We will get you set up, walk through how our phone banks work, give you a script to help guide your conversations, and answer any questions you might have.

RSVP now, and invite a friend to join you!

We need your help talking to voters about Democrats up and down the ticket. A phone bank is a great way to reach voters and talk about issues we all care about.

Whether you’re new to campaigns or an expert, you have a place with our people-powered campaign. The good news is, phone banking is easy to learn and can be done from the comfort of your own home!

You will need a phone (and a laptop or tablet, if you have one). Prior to your phonebanking shift, your local organizer will reach out for a comprehensive training, where we’ll get you set up, walk you through our phonebanking process and script, and answer any questions you might have.

column8: Climate Change and the Detroit River
column9:
*Special Weekend Edition of Downriver's Topic Tuesday*

Join Michigan Democrats in Downriver for our weekly policy chat, where we **dive into climate policy** and discuss our Democratic plans for the White house. The climate crisis is making weather more extreme, affecting American lives with one natural disaster after another. We need to transform our world into a greener, more sustainable future to protect the coming generations and ensure they live with the same diversity of nature that we do.  **Joe Biden and Gary Peters have plans on how to move America to the greener future we need, to protect lives here in the USA and all life around the world.**

Meet our Downriver Organizing Team and talk about the Detroit River, and how we can be the best stewards to our natural resources here at home. Have some lunch with us, and build our community here as downriver democrats. We will discuss the policy, and what local action you can take to make sure we get the representation we deserve.

If you’re a regular phone banker, you’ll get lots of information to share with voters on the phone, and if you are new to phone banking or considering how else you can make a difference this historic election, we’ll get you connected to the best way you can ensure you **don’t wake up on November 4th thinking “I wish I had done something”.**

Have lunch with a friend or family member and join us over zoom for this virtual event. Once you sign-up, you’ll receive an email with a Zoom link to access the organizing meeting. If you have any questions, please don’t hesitate to reach out to the event organizer by emailing tkunz@1campaignMI.com

column9:

Check out Marcia Morgan HERE:  https://countytocountync.org/marcia-morgan

We'd love to have you join our team, so please sign up for a phone bank.  We will provide online training and text and phone support so that you will feel confident joining the phone banks from your home.

Join us in our work with partner counties across the state.

column9:

The most effective way for us to reach voters right now is through phone calls, and we need you to help us get the word out to make sure Democrats can have their voices heard.

WHAT YOU'LL NEED
— A computer with reliable internet service
— A mobile or landline phone
— A comfy, quiet place in your home

To get started, we recommend opening the phone bank and getting set up a few minutes before your scheduled start time so you can focus on having good conversations for your full shift. We recommend using a recent version of Chrome or Firefox as your internet browser to access the link.

We encourage all active and prospective phone bankers to join our remote volunteer community Slack for live support.

Learn how to use an Open Virtual Phone Bank link here.https://www.openvpb.com/VirtualPhoneBank/

column8: Social Media Training 📱🌐
column9:
We have one of the most powerful organizing tool available to us in the palm of our hand. The Internet.

The Internet was supposed to change our democracy, make it easier to share information and to communicate with one another. For better or worse, it has changed the very fabric of our society.

Using social media can be difficult, and it can be even more difficult to know how use social media in a way that mobilizes people to take action for our cause. But social media is a powerful tool to reach many people in our social network at once.

Before getting involved in this campaign, I have worked with a variety of community organizations that have successfully used Facebook groups and Twitter to mobilize people in their communities. This upcoming Wednesday, I want to share those tips and tricks with you. When used correctly, social media can be an incredibly powerful tool that will help us flip Arizona blue in November.

It can be daunting, but we're in this together.

column8: Mt. Lebanon's Saturday Back to Blue Virtual Phone Bank
column9:
Join us for a virtual phone bank to talk with voters in Mt. Lebanon about electing Pennsylvania Democrats up and down the ballot!

The most effective way for us to reach voters right now is through phone calls, and we need you to help us get the word out to make sure Democrats can have their voices heard.

WHAT YOU'LL NEED
— A computer with reliable internet service
— A mobile or landline phone
 — A comfy, quiet place in your home

To get started, we recommend opening the phone bank and getting set up a few minutes before your scheduled start time so you can focus on having good conversations for your full shift. We recommend using a recent version of Chrome or Firefox as your internet browser to access the link.

We encourage all active and prospective phone bankers to [join our remote volunteer community Slack for live support: https://join.slack.com/t/back2bluepa/shared_invite/zt-fq3zpakh-8VR4X3jm0IY0G8j7YETpQg

Learn how to use an Open Virtual Phone Bank link: https://drive.google.com/file/d/19rHzEZYmNiYi_mZoX8-_rLWNKbchYwR1/view).

We will send you the phone bank link ahead of your shift!

column8: Scottsdale August Sunday Weekend of Action!
column9:
We need your help to close out our LAST SUMMER Virtual Weekend of Action, talking to voters about Democrats up and down the ticket. A phone bank is a great way to reach voters and talk about issues we all care about.

With the importance placed on Arizona this November, we need to reach out and talk to voters about Mark Kelly and Democrats now, even as we practice social distancing. Virtual phone banks have become an essential part of turning Arizona blue, and every phonbanker plays a pivotal role. This will be our biggest weekend yet as a campaign, and we need your help.

Whether you’re new to campaigns or an expert, you have a place with our people-powered campaign. The good news is, phone banking is easy to learn and can be done from the comfort of your own home!

You will need a phone (and a laptop or tablet, if you have one). Prior to your phonebanking shift, your local organizer will reach out for a comprehensive training, where we’ll get you set up, walk you through our phonebanking process and script, and answer any questions you might have.

Volunteers will help Mission for Arizona unite Democrats across Arizona and build upon our historic success in 2018 to elect Mark Kelly and Democrats up and down the ticket.

RSVP today and invite a friend to join us!

column8: Epidemics: Policy and Prevention for COVID-19
column9:
Join Mission for Arizona volunteer leader Bea Krauss for an illustrated history of how infectious diseases spread and the measures taken to monitor and to interrupt epidemics. We will discuss what is known and unknown about SARS-CoV-2 (the infectious agent) and COVID-19 (the illness). Dr. Krauss will talk about how we can craft messages to improve prevention. There will be ample time for discussion and questions at the end of the presentation.

About our presenter: Dr. Beatrice Krauss, Ph.D., is an Emerita Professor of the City University of New York Graduate School of Public Health and Health Policy; she is also a Fellow of the American Psychology Association’s Health Psychology Division. Until 2012, she was the Executive Director of the Hunter College Center for Community and Urban Health, also co-chairing the Non-Governmental Organization Committee on HIV/AIDS for organizations in consultative status to the Economic and Social Council of the United
Nations.

Dr. Krauss’s career largely focused on HIV prevention, with one intervention disseminated across New York State, to Miami, Mexico, and Mumbai, India. She is currently consulting with the University of Arizona School of Public Health and the Pima County Public Health Department on preventing COVID-19.

column8: Healthcare Open Mic Night! (SouthWest Ohio Weekend of Action)
column9:
Political issues are often affect each of us in personal ways. This is extremely true when it comes to healthcare. We want to create a space for folks to speak out about their experiences in the American Health Care system.

We want everyone to be able to tell their story in the way that best suits them. Feel free to bring a poem, a story, or whatever is best for you. Anyone can speak up, but if you want to guarantee time to tell your story, email me mitchel.herr@2020victory.com before the event so I can make sure there's time for you to speak. To give everyone time, we ask that you keep your story to around 5 minutes.

If you have any questions or want to sign up to speak, email mitchel.herr@2020victory.com!

This is your opportunity to meet your local organizers, learn more about the candidates who are running up and down the ballot, and get involved with our campaign to flip Michigan back to blue.

Join us over zoom for this virtual event. Once you sign-up, you’ll receive an email with a Zoom link to access the organizing meeting. If you have any questions, please don’t hesitate to reach out to the event organizer by emailing aclark@1campaignMI.com

column8: Phone Bank and Meet & Greet with One Campaign Michigan's Out-of-State Director!
column9:
Join Michigan Democrats for a virtual phone bank! This is a huge year for Michigan, and we need all hands on deck to send Joe Biden to the White House, re-elect Senator Gary Peters and elect Democrats up and down the ballot. You can help take part in this crucial effort by making calls from home.

Our event will kick off with a training to make sure you have all the information you need to have a fun and successful shift. All you need to make calls is a phone, computer or tablet, and access to the internet. Once you sign-up, you’ll receive an email with a link to access the training.

Have questions about registering to make calls or logging in? Please contact Caroline at cdvorsky@1campaignmi.com.

RSVP now and invite your friends to get involved and build back a better America.

We'd love to have you join our team, so please sign up for a phone bank.  We will provide online training and text and phone support so that you will feel confident joining the phone banks from your home.

The County to County Campaign is focused on turning the NC General Assembly BLUE! If we can do this, we will advance policies that benefit all North Carolinians and stop extreme partisan gerrymandering.

Join us in our work with partner counties across the state.

Each event will kick off with a quick training to make sure you have all the information you need to have a fun and successful shift. We’ll provide you with a virtual list of phone numbers to call and a script to help guide your conversation. All you need to make calls is a phone, computer or tablet, and access to the internet. Once you sign-up, you’ll receive an email with a link to access the training.

Have questions about registering to make calls, logging-in, the script, or anything else? Shoot the event organizer an email at msperry@1campaignmi.com

Before your shift starts, your local organizer will reach out to give you all the training you need to start phone banking. We will get you set up, walk through how our phone banks work, give you a script to help guide your conversations, and answer any questions you might have.

RSVP now, and invite a friend to join you!

column8: Back 2 Blue x Philly Young Dems Virtual Phonebank
column9:
Join us for a virtual phone bank to talk with voters in Philadelphia about electing Pennsylvania Democrats up and down the ballot!

The most effective way for us to reach voters right now is through phone calls, and we need you to help us get the word out to make sure Democrats can have their voices heard.

WHAT YOU'LL NEED
— A computer with reliable internet service
— A mobile or landline phone
 — A comfy, quiet place in your home

To get started, we recommend opening the phone bank and getting set up a few minutes before your scheduled start time so you can focus on having good conversations for your full shift. We recommend using a recent version of Chrome or Firefox as your internet browser to access the link.

column8: Out of State: August Weekend of Action Phonebank!
column9:
Join us for our August Statewide Virtual Weekend of Action!

**Please Note: When signing up for a shift, Arizona is currently in the Pacific Time Zone and all shifts should correspond to Pacific Time!**

We need your help during our Statewide Virtual Weekend of Action talking to voters about Democrats up and down the ticket. A phone bank is a great way to reach voters and talk about issues we all care about.

With the importance placed on Arizona this November, we need to reach out and talk to voters about Joe Biden, Mark Kelly and Democrats now, even as we practice social distancing. Virtual phone banks have become an essential part of turning Arizona blue, and every phonbanker plays a pivotal role.  This will be our biggest weekend yet as a campaign, and we need your help.

Whether you’re new to campaigns or an expert, you have a place with our people-powered campaign. The good news is, phone banking is easy to learn and can be done from the comfort of your own home!

You will need a phone (and a laptop or tablet, if you have one). Prior to your phonebanking shift, your local organizer will reach out for a comprehensive training, where we’ll get you set up, walk you through our phonebanking process and script, and answer any questions you might have.

Volunteers will help Mission for Arizona unite Democrats across Arizona and build upon our historic success in 2018 to elect Joe Biden, Mark Kelly and Democrats up and down the ticket.

RSVP today and invite a friend to join us!

column8: Virtual Phone Bank Party with Joanna Bryn Smith for State Rep.
column9:

We'll hear from Joanna, go over the script, and answer questions.

New phone bankers can join at 5:30 PM for a brief training on the mechanics of using an open virtual phone bank and some phone banking tips.

Phone banking is a super important way to reach voters during this time. We will give you the tools you need to feel comfortable and to be effective. Plus, calling is more fun with friends--even on Zoom!

Thanks for signing up to learn and to make a difference!

Convention week is the best time to be fired up and making some calls for our Democratic candidates!

The most effective way for us to reach voters right now is through phone calls, and we need you to help us get the word out to make sure Democrats can have their voices heard.

WHAT YOU'LL NEED
— A computer with reliable internet service
— A mobile or landline phone
— A comfy, quiet place in your home

To get started, we recommend opening the phone bank and getting set up a few minutes before your scheduled start time so you can focus on having good conversations for your full shift. We recommend using a recent version of Chrome or Firefox as your internet browser to access the link.

We encourage all active and prospective phone bankers to join our remote volunteer community Slack for live support.

Learn how to use an Open Virtual Phone Bank link: https://drive.google.com/file/d/19rHzEZYmNiYi_mZoX8-_rLWNKbchYwR1/view. We will send you the phone bank link the day of your shift!

column8: Adopt NC: Out-of-State Text Team Training
column9:
This training is for OUT-OF-STATE volunteers who do not live in North Carolina.

To elect Joe Biden and NC Democrats up and down the ticket, we need to talk to as many North Carolinians as possible.
That's why we're building a team of volunteers who can send texts from home to encourage voters to join our team to flip NC blue!

Texting is one of the most strategic ways to have personal conversations with voters. All you’ll need is a computer or cell phone to join our community of texting volunteers. We provide you with training, resources, and guidance to set you up for success!

Join us to learn more about being a part of our NC Text Team and for a training session on how to send texts!

Note: The first text bank shift for out-of-state volunteers will be Wednesday, August 19th from 4:30PM-8PM ET, but you should plan on attending this training first so you're positioned for success!

column8: North Philadelphia-United for Biden: Convention Kick off Watch Party
column9:
You’re invited to join our North Philadelphia and Team Biden for a virtual Convention Watch Party this Monday evening! Alongside your hosts, Felipe, Avery, and Justin, watch live coverage of the Democratic National Convention’s action-packed opening night. You’ll share a front-row seat to this historic night with other enthusiastic, passionate voters.

Monday evening’s program will highlight the importance of coming together, bridging our divides, and celebrating our differences. Former first lady Michelle Obama will share the stage with Vermont Sen. Bernie Sanders, and former Ohio Gov. John Kasich. What better way to spread this message of unity than sharing this evening together?

This is also a great opportunity to learn more about how you can get involved with the #BacktoBlue team, and help us elect Democrats up and down the ballot in Philadelphia and across Pennsylvania! The Convention is a huge milestone, but we still have a long road ahead of us before November 3.

Upon signing up, you will receive a link to join our call. If you have any accessibility needs, please contact Felipe at felipe.afanador@2020victory.com, and we’ll make sure the virtual meeting will be accessible and comfortable for you. Join us!

column8: Author-Activist Amy Siskind: How We Rescue America in 2020!
column9:
Join progressive friends throughout Pennsylvania for a free, energizing evening with Amy Siskind, author of The Weekly List, on Thursday Aug. 13 at 8 PM. She will discuss authoritarianism and voter suppression and motivate us for pandemic-capable organizing for a cheat-proof victory in November. Siskind wrote The List: A Week-by-Week Reckoning of Trump’s First Year, and is a political rock star known for her potent observations on this administration’s path of destruction.

This event is co-hosted by Turn PA Blue and Better PA, a giving circle with Future Now that is crowd-sourcing donations to flip the Pennsylvania House. Additional event supporters and leaders include all Pennsylvania Indivisible chapters, Democratic committees, and many other progressive organizations.

This is a free community event. Please spread the word! If you would like to make a donation, your contribution will directly benefit the eight candidates who have been vetted and endorsed by Future Now: Howie Hayes, Brittney Rodas, Gary Spillane, Jonathan Kassa, Nancy Guenst, Anton Andrew, Deb Ciamacca, and Claudette Williams! We are thrilled to announce that all donations will be matched. [Donate Here!](https://secure.actblue.com/donate/barkitblue)

Click [HERE](https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSf06RPyjPtGL5jMuUqCIbJ8Hv0IgDGSdkfSs_hNg4jDW10b1A/viewform) to also Bark-it-Blue with a pledge to donate $1 or more each time Amy Siskind’s Facebook celebrity dog, Arleen, barks during our event! We’ll keep track and encourage honor-system buck-a-bark (or more) donations at the end of Amy’s talk. Don’t worry we won’t bark-you-broke!

column8: Protecting & Growing Iowa’s Biofuels Jobs Virtual Meet & Greet
column9:
We're happy to have Tim Gannon, 5th generation farmer and former USDA official, join Theresa to discuss protecting and expanding Iowa’s ethanol and biofuels industry. Join us Wednesday, August 12 at 6:30 PM for our virtual meet & greet!

While we wish we could visit in-person, Theresa's "Hear it From the Heartland" tour is going virtual, using Zoom, to make sure she can keep listening to Iowans across the state while we're all doing our part to stop the spread COVID-19.

After registering, you will receive a confirmation email containing information about joining the meeting.

Businesswoman and Democratic nominee for U.S. Senate in Iowa, Theresa Greenfield grew up working on her family farm and put herself through college. After her first husband was killed in a work accident as a union electrician, Theresa relied on Social Security to support herself and her two young children. Theresa has a unique ability to speak to folks all over the state and is in an increasingly strong position to defeat Senator Ernst and flip control of the U.S. Senate. Recent polls, including The Des Moines Register's Iowa Poll, currently show Theresa ahead of Senator Ernst in a very competitive race.

Please be aware that Theresa Greenfield for Iowa (the “Campaign”) will be videotaping, recording and taking photographs during this virtual event. By entering into or in any way participating in the virtual event, you irrevocably consent to and authorize the Campaign, and its agents and licensees, to make photographs, videotapes and other recordings of your voice and likeness (“Materials”) and to use the Materials, or any portion thereof, in any and all manner and media and for any purpose without compensation. Unless you have obtained prior approval from the Campaign, you also agree to not record, reproduce, transmit or stream from the virtual event, in any manner or by any means whatsoever, any portion of, or the entirety of, the event, including making any photographs, videotapes or other recordings. Any video, recordings, photographs or other media of any kind generated during the virtual event shall be the sole property of the Campaign, and you irrevocably release the Campaign and anyone acting under its authorization from any and all liability or claims in connection with such usage. You understand and agree that the Campaign will proceed in reliance upon such grant and release and that such rights are therefore irrevocable and granted in perpetuity.

column8: Wednesday Phone Bank for Pam Iovino w/ Special Guest Sen. Tim Kearney
column9:
Senator Pam Iovino and her bellwether PA Senate district (SD-37) are a top target of Harrisburg Republicans who want to expand their majority. **Right now, phone banking is the best tool we have to defend Pam's seat and keep Dems on pace to flip the PA Senate!**

Join the Pam for PA team and special guest Tim Kearney this Wednesday for a phone bank to reach critical Southwest PA voters.


WHAT YOU'LL NEED
— A computer with reliable internet service
— A mobile or landline phone
 — A comfy, quiet place in your home


-----
GETTING STARTED

We recommend opening the phone bank and getting set up fifteen minutes before your schedule start time—so you can focus on having good conversations for your full shift!

If your primary internet browser is Apple Safari, the platform we use will not work. Please use a recent version of Chrome or Firefox to access the link.


-----
FIRST TIME CALLER?

No problem! We welcome all volunteers and are happy to train first-time phone bankers. Please follow these three steps to get going:

1) [Learn how to make calls ](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Oj621RtwtCfUvO4MZWycZ2bSXbnmXJoJo0P8qX8SMvA/edit?usp=sharing)

2) [Join PA Dems' remote volunteer chat on Slack for live support!](https://join.slack.com/t/back2bluepa/shared_invite/zt-fq3zpakh-8VR4X3jm0IY0G8j7YETpQg)

Also, feel free to [sign up for a virtual phone bank training via Back To Blue PA.](https://www.mobilize.us/backtobluepa/event/267684/) before you start making calls!

We’d like to show you how much we appreciate our volunteers and spend some time getting to know you.  If you’re new to campaigns - this is a great place to start! You can ask questions, get your tech set up, and learn more about the topics you might get asked about over the phone so you feel prepared.

column8: Les Miserables Watch Party
column9:
The national uprising in support for black lives has brought about many new ideas on how to fix our current justice system. Words like defund and abolition are being hotly debated around our country and in our own homes. Les Miserables is a story of a man caught in a perpetual cycle of poverty and crime and the ways he must lie and cheat to get out of that system.
Join us as we sing-along to all of the songs and work towards getting #JusticeForJeanValjean. During the movie we will chat and relate the themes of the film to our current moment.

Note: You will have to install Netflix Party to your device or browser before participating. You will receive a link to join the party at 5 PM.

column8: Scottsdale Saturday August Weekend of Action!!!
column9:
We need your help during our LAST SUMMER Virtual Weekend of Action, talking to voters about Democrats up and down the ticket. A phone bank is a great way to reach voters and talk about issues we all care about.

With the importance placed on Arizona this November, we need to reach out and talk to voters about Mark Kelly and Democrats now, even as we practice social distancing. Virtual phone banks have become an essential part of turning Arizona blue, and every phonbanker plays a pivotal role. This will be our biggest weekend yet as a campaign, and we need your help.

Whether you’re new to campaigns or an expert, you have a place with our people-powered campaign. The good news is, phone banking is easy to learn and can be done from the comfort of your own home!

You will need a phone (and a laptop or tablet, if you have one). Prior to your phonebanking shift, your local organizer will reach out for a comprehensive training, where we’ll get you set up, walk you through our phonebanking process and script, and answer any questions you might have.

Volunteers will help Mission for Arizona unite Democrats across Arizona and build upon our historic success in 2018 to elect Mark Kelly and Democrats up and down the ticket.

RSVP today and invite a friend to join us!

column8: 🎥 Fired Up! Slay the Dragon Post-Film Screening Discussion with Special Guests
column9:
**Fire it up for the Michigan campaigns with a lively discussion inspired by Slay the Dragon.** We're joining our friends at East Bay Activist Alliance (www.eastbayactivistalliance.org) and fellow volunteers for a post-screening discussion of the powerful new documentary, Slay the Dragon

+ *About the successful grassroots campaign to end partisan gerrymandering in Michigan and beyond*
+ *"The most important political film of the year, and it may prove to be one of the key political films of the decade." ~ Variety*

+ *Learn more at www.slaythedragonfilm.com*

We'll be joined by **Jamie Lyons-Eddy from Voters Not Politicians** (VNP) (www.votersnotpoliticians.com), the organization which led the 2018 ballot initiative Redistricting Reform Amendment, **Julia Pulver (www.juliapulver.com, MI HD-39)** and possibly **another amazing Michigan State House candidate** — all of whom support **VNP’s VoteSafe campaign to protect our elections during the pandemic.**

+ Note: this is not a film screening, but a post-film screening discussion. Film can be streamed through multiple services; see www.slaythedragonfilm.com/watch-at-home.

+ Though recommended, seeing the film is not a prerequisite for our conversation about the strengths of grassroots activism toward a representative democracy in Michigan and beyond.
+ Learn more about Super State Michigan at https://youtu.be/x0ub5tEShjQ
+ **Event is scheduled for Sun. 8/16 5 pm PT/8 pm ET**

column8: Pick Up Prepare and Drop Off Vote Forward Letters in North Berkeley - August 22 and 23
column9:
It's time to get to work on 2020! Even though lots of us are isolated right now to protect our communities, we can still get together virtually to make an impact! Join me for a virtual letter writing party, where we'll be writing letters to potential voters in a critical election. This award-winning, proven tactic will help us work on crucial races all over the country!

RSVP here, and we’ll let you know how to pickup printed letters in a safe way for you to prepare at home and return once prepared. Invite your friends, too and let them know that Swing Left is pioneering an innovative program, using letters to help volunteers like us turn out Super State voters by mail with our letter-writing affiliate, Vote Forward.

Think about it: if you help get a voter to the polls in one of our targeted Super States, you can impact key State races necessary to roll back gerrymanders. That’s what Swing Left's Super State Strategy is all about: maximizing the impact of your time and money! Looking forward to seeing you!

column8: Let's Swing AZ and TX Blue Together!
column9:
Only 15 weeks to go! We have a lot of ground to cover, and we need your help more than ever! Join me for an SL SGV virtual letter-writing party (LWP), where we'll be writing letters to potential voters in Arizona or Texas, the two states SL SGV adopted.

All you need is 20: 20 letters, 20 envelopes and 20 1st-class stamps. Before our party, go to votefwd.org , choose a campaign for AZ or TX, download 20 letters and we’ll write Get Out the Vote letters together.

Never written letters before? Go to votefwd.org and register. We'll show you how to write them.

Don't have a printer? Email me at laballetgirl@gmail.com and we'll work it out, no problem.

By getting out the vote, we can win the Presidency and the Senate, keep the House and turn red state legislatures blue. LET'S GET AT IT!

AND REMEMBER: Before our party, go to votefwd.org , choose a campaign, and download and print 20 letters.

column8: 8/16 SUN @6 ET: Write Voter Turnout Letters & hear inspiring podcast w/ Swing Left Target 2020 NYC
column9:
At this virtual party, we'll write letters to Dem voters in a critical Swing State. It's an award-winning, proven tactic from a Swing Left affiliate, Vote Forward -- we’re writing these letters now then mailing them come fall.

This week, we'll also get inspiration as we write, when we listen to an episode of the NPR Podcast Hidden Brain, where Political scientist Eitan Hersh shares insights that might just help our friends convert their politics addiction into action.

Since we can’t knock on doors, research suggests these letters may be the one of the BEST ways to turn out voters in the last weeks, in tight races all over the country.

Think about it: if you help get a voter to the polls in one of our targeted Super States, you can deliver a vote for Biden and also possibly a Senate seat, plus impact key State races necessary to roll back gerrymanders.

That’s what Swing Left's Super State Strategy is all about: identifying the voters we need to reach to maximize the impact of your time and money. We look forward to seeing you!

IMPORTANT NOTE: If you can’t print letters, write us at sltarget2020@gmail.com to get letters sent to you asap!

By clicking RSVP, you agree to Swing Left’s Organizer Liability Statement:
https://swingleft.org/p/liability

column8: Write Letters to Voters Virtually with Swing Left!
column9:
It's time to get to work on 2020!  Every Sunday from now until the election Action Together Stark Swing Left will be gathering, whether in-person or virtually, to help flip Ohio blue.

At this time we are focused on postcard writing and lit drops.  On Sunday afternoons we will distribute postcards that volunteers can complete at the park or at home.  We will also distribute lit drops -- door hangers with voter registration information for Stark County voters who have been purged.  We need that work done NOW.  Even if you don't have time to distribute the door hangers on Sundays, feel free to pick up a stack and distribute when you can!

If you are not able to pick up the postcards/door hangers on Sundays, message me and we can arrange a drop off.

Stark County dems also offer phone banking on Thursdays, we can get you the contact information.

RSVP here, and we’ll let you know how to join this party online. Invite your friends, too and let them know that Swing Left is pioneering an innovative program, using letters to help volunteers like us turn out Super State voters by mail with our letter-writing affiliate, Vote Forward.

Never written letters before? Hop on to votefwd.org and make an account; download twenty letters; and we’ll show you how to write them at our virtual party!

Think about it: if you help get a voter to the polls in one of our targeted Super States, you can impact key State races necessary to roll back gerrymanders. That’s what Swing Left's Super State Strategy is all about: maximizing the impact of your time and money! Looking forward to seeing you!

column8: Countdown to Election Day (80 Days from Event!) Virtual Letter Writing Party
column9:
Let's get together (virtually) again to write some more letters to potential voters in critical states!

How to get your letters to write? There are 2 possible ways:

If you live in the area, I have printed packets of 20 letters + envelopes. You let me know how many you want and when you're swinging by and I can leave packets in my mailbox (street level) with your name on them (NB: this is not recommended by SwingLeft, but I appreciate that some may not have a printer or envelopes)

OR : sign up at Vote Forward (votefwd.org) and make an account (I strongly suggest doing this a few days in advance so that you can get approved in time!). Then, download twenty letters; and we’ll show you how to write them at our virtual party! I will go over instructions and tips on filling out the letters at the start of the party (pro-tip: grab a couple of non-black pens!)

Please join with video and we write some letters! Have some nice food and drinks to go with your 20 letters--you deserve it!

After that, if you want, please drop the letters (in their envelopes) back at my mailbox (let me know when you do) and I can affix stamps (if you don't have them--please feel free to donate to a "letter writing stamp fund!").

AND--this is a great way to support the post office!

First time letter-writers GREATLY welcome! So are children (they are our future)!

Letter Writing Steps:
1. Register for Vote Forward at https://votefwd.org/swingleft
2. Confirm your Vote Forward account
3. Log back in to Vote Forward
4. Choose your campaign
5. Adopt your voters and download the letters

*If you created your vote forward account within three days of registering for this event you won't be able to adopt letters yet.*

column8: Call Voters with the Colorado Democrats: Training Session & Phone Banking
column9:
Learn how to call Colorado Voters for the Colorado Democrats, and give it a spin yourself!

In November, Colorado voters will be crucial in taking back the White House and flipping the Senate.

We are working with the Colorado Democrats to call voters in CD-3 to learn about the issues that most concern them and their families. This helps to hold officials accountable, and to build up a robust Democratic platform that reflects the needs of Coloradans!

We will be calling unaffiliated voters in CD-3. For this reason, this phone bank is best for more experienced callers. Once you sign up for this event, you'll get an email with links to all the information you need to prepare for this training & to make calls.

You’ll need a phone and a laptop computer or tablet to make calls.

Thank you for helping us transform our government by calling Colorado Democrats!

column8: Swing Left CT Phone Bank Training for New or Reluctant Phonebankers
column9:
Are you a new or reluctant phone banker?  If so, we have the event for you!

We’re excited to offer a special phone banking training led by Colleen McCarthy, a Swing Left National program manager.  The goal of this event will be to give you background on why phone banking is important, best practices for phone banking, and make sure you are set up on the technology to be able to make calls by the end of the event.

Calling voters is a key way to help win the White House, the Senate, and the state-level races key to rolling back Republican gerrymandering.  Our phone banking training will help you develop this essential skill.  Don’t worry if you’ve never done something like this before. You will also get a chance to practice your new skills by calling some voters.  All you need to provide is a phone and a laptop computer or tablet to make calls.  Remember, if we do things right, we’ll not only beat Trump and the GOP—we’ll set up the country for a decade of progressive wins!

By clicking RSVP, you agree to the Swing Left’s Organizer Liability Statement (https://swingleft.org/liability) and the guidelines described in Swing Left's Community Agreements (https://swingleft.org/community-agreements).

column8: Call the LD 17 on the 17th - August
column9:
Join us and support the amazing candidates in LD 17 whose election will be part of the historic flipping of the Arizona State Legislature.
AJ Kurdoglu, candidate for State Senate, is a first generation American and small business owner. An Industrial Engineer from Turkey he arrived in Arizona to attend the Thunderbird School of Global Management. Arizona has been his home for the last 20 years. He holds dear the freedoms and opportunities he’s found here in Arizona and wants these opportunities to be enjoyed universally for all Arizonans.
LD 17 House Representative Jennifer Pawlik is running for re-election. First elected in 2018, she currently serves on House Judiciary, Education and Joint Legislative Audit committees.
Individually and together they have so much to offer. Let's help make sure they win on Election Day so they can get to work for all of Arizona.

By clicking RSVP, you agree to the Swing Left’s Organizer Liability Statement (https://swingleft.org/liability) and the guidelines described in Swing Left's Community Agreements (https://swingleft.org/community-agreements).

column8: Write Letters to Voters Virtually with Swing Left!
column9:
It's time to get to work on 2020! Even though lots of us are isolated right now to protect our communities, we can still get together virtually to make an impact! Join me for a virtual letter writing party, where we'll be writing letters to potential voters in a critical election. This award-winning, proven tactic will help us work on crucial races all over the country!

RSVP here, and we’ll let you know how to join this party online. Invite your friends, too and let them know that Swing Left is pioneering an innovative program, using letters to help volunteers like us turn out Super State voters by mail with our letter-writing affiliate, Vote Forward.

Never written letters before? Hop on to votefwd.org and make an account; download twenty letters; and we’ll show you how to write them at our virtual party!

Think about it: if you help get a voter to the polls in one of our targeted Super States, you can impact key State races necessary to roll back gerrymanders. That’s what Swing Left's Super State Strategy is all about: maximizing the impact of your time and money! Looking forward to seeing you!

By clicking RSVP, you agree to the Swing Left’s Organizer Liability Statement (https://swingleft.org/liability) and the guidelines described in Swing Left's Community Agreements (https://swingleft.org/community-agreements).

column8: Call Arizona LD 23 on the 23rd
column9:
Join us in support of the great candidates in LD 23 whose election will be part of the historic flipping of the Arizona State Legislature.
Seth Blattman, State Senate candidate, knows how to make tough decisions. During the great recession he left his graduate studies and returned to Arizona to help rebuild his family’s business. He is now committed to serving Arizona to build a stronger economy that supports education and safe communities.
Eric Kurland has been a teacher for 20 years. For each of those 20 years education was underfunded while prison funding increased. He is running to reverse these priorities and put an end to the double-standards used to insulate incumbents from public accountability.
Individually and together they have so much to offer. Let's help make sure they win on Election Day so they can get to work for all of Arizona.

By clicking RSVP, you agree to the Swing Left’s Organizer Liability Statement (https://swingleft.org/liability) and the guidelines described in Swing Left's Community Agreements (https://swingleft.org/community-agreements).

column8: Calling LD 21 on the 21st - August
column9:
Join us and support the amazing LD 21 candidate for State House, Kathy Knecht, whose election will be part of the historic flipping of the Arizona State Legislature.
Kathy has served the West Valley for decades as a school board member for 12 years and a champion of economic development and education. She is a Lifetime “Blue Blazer” volunteer for Luke AFB. She is looking forward to serving the interests of the public, not special interests.
Kathy has so much to offer, let's help make sure she wins on Election Day so she can get to work for all of Arizona.
By clicking RSVP, you agree to the Swing Left’s Organizer Liability Statement (https://swingleft.org/liability) and the guidelines described in Swing Left's Community Agreements (https://swingleft.org/community-agreements).

column8: Calling LD 20 on the 20th - August
column9:
Join us and support the amazing candidates in LD 20 whose election will be part of the historic flipping of the Arizona State Legislature.
Self described accounting geek, State Senate candidate Doug Ervin has called Arizona home since he was three. His engagement with politics mirrored his increasing involvement with the community as a volunteer with educational, environmental and community organizations. He became a candidate after witnessing the legislature regularly putting party before people and jeopardizing Arizona’s future for short-term political gains.
Judy Schwiebert taught school in LD 20 for 27 years, was co-founder of theatre works and founder of Desert Progressives. Her life experience has taught her the magnifying power of listening and working together. Doing so gives everyone the chance to thrive. She is excited to bring this perspective to the Arizona state capitol as LD 20 Representative.
Individually and together they have so much to offer. Let's help make sure they win on Election Day so they can get to work for all of Arizona.

column8: Write Letters to Voters Virtually with Indivisible Oregon and Swing Left!
column9:
Indivisible Oregon’s letter writing parties are going virtual!!

Just because we are at home doesn’t mean we can’t get together virtually to make an impact. Join us for a virtual letter writing party, where we'll be writing letters to potential voters in a critical election. This award-winning, proven tactic will help us work on crucial races all over the country!

Once you RSVP, you’ll get an email with instructions on downloading and printing your letters through Vote Forward, along with the link to join the Zoom meeting. If you haven’t downloaded your own letters before, we promise it’s easy - and we’re here to help if you have any trouble.

column8: Swing Left Guilford NC House Town Hall
column9: Smaller races have a BIG impact, so Swing Left Guilford is hosting a series of Virtual Town Halls to highlight local races. This 3rd in the series will focus on progressive candidates in Guilford County who are running for North Carolina House seats. The candidates will be able to introduce themselves and their platforms to voters, they will be asked questions about issues critical to North Carolina and Guilford County, and voters will be able to ask them questions, too. Get the Zoom link by emailing us at swingleftguilford@gmail.com.

column8: Swing Left's National Virtual Letter Writing Party - the Michigan Sequel!
column9:
Now’s the time to work on the 2020 elections! Even though lots of us are isolated right now to protect our communities, we can still get together virtually to make an impact. Join Swing Left staff and volunteers from around the country for a virtual letter writing party supporting races up and down the ballot in Michigan. It’s fun - we’ll have Michigan tunes and trivia as we write letters!

We'll be hand-writing letters to potential Michigan voters asking them to vote in November. This proven tactic will help turn out the vote for Democrats in our 12 Super States!

RSVP here, and we’ll let you know how to join this party online. Invite your friends, too, and let them know that Swing Left is hosting a big, innovative program  that can effectively turn out Super State voters from home, using a great letter writing tool from Vote Forward. Volunteers have already written almost 3 million letters!

Never written letters before? Hop on to [votefwd.org/swingleft](https://www.swingleft.org/vote-fwd-signup-0822) and make an account; download twenty letters from Vote Forward’s [Michigan](https://votefwd.org/district/MIGOTV2020B); and we’ll show you how to write them at our virtual party!

Think about it: if you help get a voter to the polls in Michigan, you can help elect Democrats to flip the White House and the Michigan State Legislature —all at the same time. That’s what Swing Left's Super State Strategy is all about: maximizing the impact of your time or donations.

Looking forward to seeing you!

By clicking RSVP, you agree to the Swing Left’s Organizer Liability Statement (https://swingleft.org/liability) and the guidelines described in Swing Left's Community Agreements (https://swingleft.org/community-agreements)

column8: SLSF August 16 Postcard Party for TJ Cox
column9:
At the request of TJ Cox's campaign, we will be writing postcards to voters in TJ's district, CA-21. This is a way to connect with hard-to-reach voters in his district.

Join us for a morning postcard party on August 16 from 11am - 12:30pm. Make yourself a big pot of coffee and settle in with us to write out some postcards. We'll do a quick explainer at the start, and then we can all hang out and write together with some fun music and occasional check-ins.

The event "doors" will open at 10:45am so you can sort out any Zoom issues, or to just to chat a bit with your hosts and other activists.

RSVP by August  12th. You'll get a reminder email from us the day before the event asking you to confirm your attendance. Then we'll send you a Zoom link, the script and voter addresses.

Be sure to order postcards and stamps so they arrive in plenty of time. Staples has cheap blank cards; Postcards to Voters sells fun postcards through their website, or you can purchase pre-stamped postcards from the USPS website. It's taking about two weeks for the Post Office to fulfill orders.

By clicking RSVP, you agree to Swing Left’s Organizer Liability Statement.



By clicking RSVP, you agree to Swing Left’s Organizer Liability Statement.

column8: SLSF: Aug. 13 & 20 Spanish for Phone Banking
column9:
Do you speak Spanish AND want to reclaim our democracy? This two-part workshop will teach you strategies for engaging in meaningful conversations with voters who are most comfortable speaking Spanish. We’ll include specific vocabulary and tips on phone etiquette to help you navigate the critical first 30 seconds of a phone conversation – including phrases that communicate respect and help you earn voters’ trust. We’ll also cover topics from current phone banks, including wellness checks and encouraging vote-by-mail.

This interactive class will be co-taught by a native Spanish-speaking language instructor and an experienced phone banker. This is an intermediate-level class and will be conducted mostly in Spanish. Some experience with phone banking is preferred but not required. We’re keeping the class size small, so please only sign up if you can commit to attending the whole workshop.

If you’d like a sneak preview, or want to see if this workshop is appropriate for your level of Spanish, check out our class videos here.

Thursday, Aug. 13 and Thursday, Aug. 20 from 2:00-4:00 pm Pacific Time (Please attend both sessions)

RSVP by Tuesday, Aug. 11 (space is limited)

(Questions? Interested in this workshop but can’t attend this one? Please email Elizabeth Chur at peregrina2003@gmail.com.)


By clicking RSVP, you agree to Swing Left’s Organizer Liability Statement.

column8: SLSF/SDSF August 23 Arizona Phone Bank
column9:
Join Swing Left SF and Sister District SF for a virtual phone bank, where we'll be calling for Arizona state legislature candidates Coral Evans and Felicia French.

We'll do a quick online training at the beginning of the phone bank before getting you set up to make calls. We'll be available the entire time for questions and feedback. You don't need to participate for the entire phone bank, just make as many calls as you like. You must register 24 hours before the phone bank in order to get the Zoom link.

column8: Friday Write To Voters with Indivisible North Coast Oregon
column9:
We’re excited to have you join us!  We’re volunteers writing letters to voters to defeat Trump and flip the Senate this November.


Never written letters before? Hop on to votefwd.org and make an account; download twenty letters; and we’ll show you how to write them at our virtual party!

To participate in this virtual letter writing party, you’ll need to download and print letters, gather materials ahead of time, and join the party on a video conference using Zoom.

We recommend getting started now as it may take several days to get approved as a volunteer with Vote Forward.

Here’s what you need to do:
1. Sign up with Vote Forward at swingleft.org/letters
2. Once you are approved as a volunteer, please review how to be
         prepared for the party at swingleft.org/letters-from-home
3. Download 20 letters for this event.

 RSVP here, and we’ll let you know how to join this party online. Invite your friends, too and let them know that Swing Left is pioneering an innovative program, using letters to help volunteers like us turn out Super State voters by mail with our letter-writing affiliate, Vote Forward.

Looking forward to seeing you!

column8: Weekend of Action Harnett County (CD-07) Virtual Phone Bank!
column9:
Join Harnett County organizers for a virtual phone bank to make phone calls to other NC Democrats! We’ll be talking to our friends and neighbors about our campaign and what’s at stake in this election.

Whether you are a seasoned veteran or volunteering for the first time, now is the time to act. Invite a friend, bring your Team Joe spirit, and help elect Democrats up and down the ballot in North Carolina. RSVP today!

column8: Democratic National Convention Watch Party
column9: Join fellow Arizona Democrats to watch the third day of the Democratic Convention virtually from the comfort of your own home! We will celebrate being Democrats and look forward to the fight ahead. Watch party stream information will be provided after your sign up.

column8: Pueblo Convention Watch Party
column9: Join Democrats across Colorado to watch the Democratic National Convention! We'll come together, virtually, to watch the convention and take action each day. Joining a watch party is a great way to meet your fellow Democrats and learn more about what you can do to help elect Joe Biden and Democrats down the ballot in Colorado!

column8: Phonebanking for Beginners - Voter Protection PA!!
column9: Have you always been curious about phonebanking but unsure of how to get started? Fear not! Swing Left Greater Boston will walk you through every step of the process. We know that making calls can seem intimidating at first, but it is the simplest and most effective way for us to reach voters right now, and we want to help you get the hang of it. All you’ll need is a laptop, battery/charger, phone, headphones and pen and paper! We will go through the script in detail, practice scenarios that may occur while you’re calling, and answer any and all questions that may come up. Bring your family and friends! All are welcome in the Swing Left Greater Boston phone banking community. We look forward to meeting you!

column8: Bucks County Convention Week "Whisper Down The Lane" HD143
column9:
Get ready for Bucks County's Largest Game of "Whisper Down The Lane". Use your phone to receive a special Convention Week message and pass it on to another supporter. Connect with fellow Democrats in your community in a fun, new way, completely from home as we gear up for Biden to accept the Democratic Nomination. Who knows - you might just get called by your favorite local Democratic celebrity!

Have questions? Shoot the event organizer an email at cdvorsky@1campaignmi.com

Thanks for joining - please invite a friend or two to join you!

column8: Letter-Writing Campaign #11 - We Will DELIVER Your Letters on August 16
column9:
Our letter-writing projects – under a Swing Left and Vote Forward initiative – encourage citizens in swing districts who are likely to vote Democratic to either register to vote or go to the polls and vote in key elections. We do this by "adopting" voters in key districts and customizing letters to them.

We currently hold our letter-writing events virtually.

We have a new process! Letters will be delivered DIRECTLY to you on Sunday, August 16. Details will be explained in an email update from Kathryn prior to the date.

Our group is self-funded, so please plan to provide your own 20 first-class stamps and 20 #10 business envelopes.

You should expect to complete your 20 letters in less than 2 hours. When you return the letters to us, we'll take care of getting the completed letters mailed out on the appropriate date.

To receive a packet of 20 letters, please register in advance for the date you want. This ensures that we download the correct number of letters (adopted voters) for everyone who wants to participate.

We hope to see you on Sunday, August 16. 😊



By clicking RSVP, you agree to Swing Left’s Organizer Liability Statement: https://swingleft.org/p/liability

column8: Take Back Pennsylvania From Your Own Living Room- Cambridge pickup
column9:
Flatten the absentee ballot request curve in Pennsylvania and turn out infrequent voters! You'll personalize and address letters and vote-by-mail applications to Democrats who are more likely to vote if they receive an absentee ballot. These same letters increased turnout significantly in Pennsylvania's primaries.

You can write the letters from your own home. Just pick up your packet of 50 addresses from a covered porch in Porter Square, customize the letters at home, and return the letters by August 22

The cost of each packet is $35 for 50 letters to reimburse the host for stamps and envelopes. Using check or exact change expedites the pick up.

## Additional Precautions
Please protect your health and the health of the community.

If you have underlying health conditions or other risk factors, please ask a friend to pick up your packets for you. We may be able to drop them off at your home; ask if you need that.

Thank you for helping us turn out Pennsylvania's Blue voters. We'll both take back the White House and blunt Republican gerrymandering!

**HOST: Amy Perlmutter**

A final note: If you don't receive an email with the pickup address, you can still find the information you need by checking "My Volunteer Schedule."  (Instructions [here](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1kCVbAJ8BSO5InlZcz-CDCbs5gblUp8KTs3ATC457_W4/edit?usp=sharing)).

column8: Write Letters to Voters from home.  Pick up materials in Falmouth!
column9:
It's time to get to work on 2020! Even though lots of us are isolated right now to protect our communities, we can still make an impact! Join me for a letter writing effort, where we'll be writing letters to potential OHIO voters in a critical election. Pick up letters and instructions and then work from home! This, proven tactic will help us work on crucial races all over the country!

RSVP here, and we’ll let you know how to pick up your letters in Falmouth. We need to turn out Super State voters by mail with our letter-writing affiliate, Vote Forward.

Think about it: if you help get a voter to the polls in one of our targeted Super States, you can impact key State races necessary to roll back gerrymanders. That’s what Swing Left's Super State Strategy is all about: maximizing the impact of your time and money! Looking forward to seeing you!
